title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement smriti.anand@pfizer.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Summary of Adverse Events
text: article pertains creating Summary table Adverse Events .e adae_r001 report using carver application. required input ADaM data ADAE dataset.

title: Summary of Adverse Events
text: Upon loading ADAE data clicking Report Inputs tab, select Report Type Table Report Name adae_r001  Treatment/PopulationRequired Treatment Population Selection, select appropriate Treatment Variable: groups data treatment-wise treatment reflect columns table. Select appropriate Treatment Sort Variable give order sorting Treatment variable subset entire data based available population flags, select Population Filter. eg. Overall, Safety (SAFFL) etc Data Pre-processing/PreparationOptional - Can use defaults Analysis Subset Condition filter condition data get counts participants/events treatment. Denominator Subset Condition filter condition data calculate percentages participants/events treatment. Percentage Denominator - denominator use calculate % terms table? ‘Treatment’ - within treatment group ‘Total’ - within variable total. Calculate Risk = Y, fixed ‘Treatment’ order calculate Risk Statistic. Select Y/N : Treatment Big N - append Treatment column names total count group format (N = count) . Total Treatment - create extra column total treatment groups/make available pair-wise selection case Calculate Risk = Y. Add Missing Grouping Variable? - Whether empty/NA values grouping (Higher Level Event Term) variable included . Calculate Risk - determines type table: ‘N’, Treatments displayed Counts % Adverse Event terms , table. ‘Y’, user selects single Treatment Pair display Counts % well Risk Difference Risk Ratio pair.  Adverse Event Filter(s) , select adverse events filtered analysis list available data. Period drop-filter required time period alone select ‘Overall Period’ take entire data ‘’ specify residual period (days) cut .  Summary select either ‘Participants’ ‘Events’ determines counts calculated. Lower Level Event Term - Variable gives list adverse event terms analysed displayed table. Higher Level Event Term - Variable used grouping Lower Level Term, values table divide Lower Level Event Term variable groups, Higher Level terms displayed bold.  table Risk - Calculate Risk = ‘Y’: Measure Association - statistic calculate, ‘Risk Difference’ ‘Risk Ratio’ Alpha Value(CI) - Give alpha value determine Confidence Interval. eg. 0.05 –> 95% CI  Control Group - Select treatment value within Treatment Variable use Control analysis Treatment Group - Select treatment value perform pair-wise analysis Control.  Display Options Cutoff Incidence - Slide minimum % incidence term (selected treatment groups) displayed table lower values removed. Sorting Option - Order sort Adverse Event terms plot - Ascending, Descending (using Sorting Variable) Alphabetical. Sorting Variable - parameter/measure used sort terms plot order Sorting Option  Table Output: selecting options, click ‘Process Report Input’ view table Table Output tab. Table Risk StatisticSorted Ascending Order Count  Table without Risk StatisticSorted Descending Order Count

title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: article describes creating reports can classified ADSL Summary Tables using adsl_summary function. Example created using ADSL domain. Note: examples assume CDISC ADaM format input unless otherwise specified.

title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: Read Data Preprocess Data ADSL Summary Table ADSL Table Display

title: Subject Level Summary Table
code: library(carver) library(dplyr) library(purrr) # nolint data(adsl)

title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: creating adsl_summary, required use pre-processing function: mentry serves essential step preparing data summarisation.

title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: next step pre-processing involves usage mentry function read process data subsets variables. takes adsl input . input data gets processed based TRT(mandatory variable generating columns final table), (optional variable used group rows final table) /SUBGROUP(optional variable used add subgroups columns-TRT final table) variables filtered subset conditions. Note: additional information parameters info, refer mentry() documentation.
code: mentry_df <- adsl |>   mentry(     subset = NA_character_,     byvar = NA_character_,     trtvar = "TRT01A",     trtsort = "TRT01AN",     subgrpvar = NA_character_,     trttotalyn = "Y",     add_grpmiss = "N",     pop_fil = "SAFFL"   )

title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: step used creating ADSL summary table using ‘adsl_summary’ function. following arguments table: datain: input data table generation. output data mentry_df function. vars: Names adsl variables display final output tilde-separated, Add "-S" numeric variables. stat_vars: Statistics display table numeric vars, tilde-separated. pctdisp: Denominator calculate percentages . Values: "TRT", "VAR", "COL", "SUBGRP", "SGRPN", "CAT", "NONE", "", "DPTVAR". total_catyn return ‘Total’ row categorical analysis vars. Values: "Y"/"N" total_catlabel Label total category row. eg- “”/“Total” miss_catyn include empty/blank values miss_catlabel categories dptvar variable . Values: "Y"/"N" miss_catlabel Label missing values a_subset Analysis Subset condition; tilde-separated variable vars. denom_subset Subset condition applied dataset calculating denominator, tilde-separated categorical variables within vars.
code: adsl_sum <- mentry_df |>   adsl_summary(     vars = "AGEGR1/AGEGR1N~AGE-S~SEX/SEXN~RACE/RACEN",     stat_vars = "N~Range~Meansd~Median~IQR",     pctdisp = "TRT",     total_catyn = "N",     total_catlabel = "Total",     miss_catyn = "N",     miss_catlabel = "Missing",     a_subset = "AGE<65~AGE>80~SEX=='F'~NA",     denom_subset = NA_character_   )

what: Prepare data for general table display
title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: step used creating ADSL summary table using ‘tbl_processor’ function prepare data general table display. following arguments: datain Input dataframe. output data adsl_summary function. dptlabel Tilde-separated labels set category variables data. analysis vars (DPTVAR) contains AGEGR1, RACE; dptlabel may "Age Group~Race". statlabel Tilde-separated labels corresponding Statistic data. extra_df Additional dataframe, merge datain. extra_mergeby Variables merge extra_df , present. dropvars Variables additional standard present input data removed output disp_value_col Hide/Show value column final display. addrowvars Group Variable(s) removed column instead used row headers value column.

what: Create flextable output from display templates
title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: step used creating ADSL summary table using ‘tbl_display’ create flextable output display templates. following arguments: datain Input dataframe. output data tbl_processor function. bylabel Change BYVAR names label, . dpthead String become name column containing categories (DPTVAL) output. font Font face text inside table fontsize Font size text inside table

title: Subject Level Summary Table
text: ADSL Summary Table generated successfully. Table generated:  Placebo (N=86) Xanomeline Low Dose (N=84) Xanomeline High Dose (N=84) Total (N=254) Age Group       <65 14 (16.28%) 8 ( 9.52%) 11 (13.10%) 33 (12.99%) NONE       N 30 29 18 77   Range _NO_STAT _NO_STAT _NO_STAT _NO_STAT   Meansd _NO_STAT _NO_STAT _NO_STAT _NO_STAT   Median 84.00 83.00 83.50 84.00   IQR 4.75 2.00 2.75 3.00 Sex       F 53 (61.63%) 50 (59.52%) 40 (47.62%) 143 (56.30%) Race       WHITE 78 (90.70%) 78 (92.86%) 74 (88.10%) 230 (90.55%)   BLACK AFRICAN AMERICAN 8 ( 9.30%) 6 ( 7.14%) 9 (10.71%) 23 ( 9.06%)   AMERICAN INDIAN ALASKA NATIVE 0 0 1 ( 1.19%) 1 ( 0.39%)
code: adsl_sum |>   display_bign_head(mentry_data = mentry_df) |>   tbl_processor(     statlabel = "N~Range~Meansd~Median~IQR",     dptlabel = "Age Group~NONE~Sex~Race",     addrowvar = "DPTVAR"   ) |>   tbl_display() |>   flextable::autofit()

Upon loading/selecting ADAE data clicking Report Inputs tab, report inputs can added. Report Type Figure Report Name Volcano Plot graph  Treatment/PopulationRequired Treatment Population Selection, select appropriate Treatment Variable: table, Treatment Variable determines columns Figure, determines differentiate groups color. Select appropriate Treatment Sort Variable give order sorting Treatment variable. subset entire data based population flags, select Population Filter. eg. Overall, Safety (SAFFL).  Processing Data: Add Edit default Analysis Subset Condition Denominator Subset Condition filter input data (calculating categorical counts alone entire data respectively)  Select Adverse Event Filter(s) - filter input data Select Period - generate figure either Overall Duration . Select Summary - helps select either Participants plot based subject count Events plot based AE counts. Select Lower Level Event Term - variable help generate figure AEBODSYS FMQ Name etc., type scatterplot shows statistical significance (P-value) versus magnitude change (fold change). Select Lower Level Event Term - variable help generate figure AEDECOD AELLT etc., type scatterplot shows statistical significance (P-value) versus magnitude change (fold change). select Measure Association - generate plot either Risk Ratio Risk Difference. Select Control Group - choose control treatment compare treatment Select Treatment Group - choose treatment compare control Update p Value Cutoff, Alpha Value(CI), Risk Reference Lines Cutoff Incidence (%) desired generate plot.  Graph Output: Click Process Report Input button switch Graph Output tab generate graph.  Note: proceeding section, highly recommended review sections 1.1 Data Import 1.1.1 Default CDISC data details giving report inputs.

title: Clinical Analysis Reporting and Visualization Ensemble in R (carver)
text: section pertains creating Forest Plot Adverse Events using carver application. required input ADaM data ADAE dataset. Upon loading ADAE data clicking Report Inputs tab, select Report Type Figure Report Name Forest Plot  Treatment/PopulationRequired Treatment Population Selection, select appropriate Treatment Variable: Treatment Variable determines grouping points scatter plot section well treatment pairs risk forest section. Select appropriate Treatment Sort Variable give order sorting Treatment variable subset entire data based available population flags, select Population Filter. eg. Overall, Safety (SAFFL) etc  Data Pre-processing/PreparationOptional - Can use defaults Analysis Subset Condition filter condition data get counts participants/events treatment. Denominator Subset Condition filter condition data calculate percentages participants/events treatment. Adverse Event Filter(s) , select adverse events filtered analysis list available data. Period drop-filter required time period alone select ‘Overall Period’ take entire data ‘’ specify residual period (days) cut .  Summary select either ‘Patients’ ‘Events’ determines counts calculated. Lower Level Event Term - Variable gives list adverse event terms analysed displayed plot Higher Level Event Term - Variable used grouping Lower Level Term, values reflected Hover information term.  Statistical Analysis Measure Association - statistic calculate, ‘Risk Difference’ ‘Risk Ratio’ Alpha Value(CI) - Give alpha value determine Confidence Interval. eg. 0.05 –> 95% CI p Value Cutoff - p-value consider difference % statistically significant. Risk Reference Lines - X axis intercept value draw vertical reference line pair-wise risk plot. Risk Axis Scale - transform risk axis plotted - log identity (values ) scales  Control Group - Select treatment value within Treatment Variable use control analysis Treatment Group - Select treatment value(s) perform pair-wise analysis Control. Selecting multiple treatments result displaying multiple pairs, eg. Control-Treatment1 Control-Treatment2 pairs case.  Graphical Display Options Cutoff Incidence - Slide minimum % incidence term (either control treatment group) displayed graph. lower values removed. p-value Transformation - Transform p-values displayed graph term - None log transform. Sorting Option - Order sort Adverse Event terms plot - Ascending, Descending (using Sorting Variable) Alphabetical. Sorting Variable - parameter/measure used sort terms plot order Sorting Option  Graph Output selected options, visualize Forest Plot Graph Output tab. Note color legend identifies risk pairs forest graph well p-value columns. incidence scatterplot, certain points also depicted larger green red points denotes statistically significant (per p value cutoff) lower higher incidence % respectively, treatment group vs control.

Lower Level Event Term - Variable gives list adverse event terms analysed displayed plot Higher Level Event Term - Variable used grouping Lower Level Term, values reflected Hover information term.  Statistical Analysis Measure Association - statistic calculate, ‘Risk Difference’ ‘Risk Ratio’ Alpha Value(CI) - Give alpha value determine Confidence Interval. eg. 0.05 –> 95% CI p Value Cutoff - p-value consider difference % statistically significant. Risk Reference Lines - X axis intercept value draw vertical reference line pair-wise risk plot. Risk Axis Scale - transform risk axis plotted - log identity (values ) scales  Control Group - Select treatment value within Treatment Variable use control analysis Treatment Group - Select treatment value(s) perform pair-wise analysis Control. Selecting multiple treatments result displaying multiple pairs, eg. Control-Treatment1 Control-Treatment2 pairs case.  Graphical Display Options Cutoff Incidence - Slide minimum % incidence term (either control treatment group) displayed graph. lower values removed. p-value Transformation - Transform p-values displayed graph term - None log transform. Sorting Option - Order sort Adverse Event terms plot - Ascending, Descending (using Sorting Variable) Alphabetical. Sorting Variable - parameter/measure used sort terms plot order Sorting Option  Graph Output selected options, visualize Forest Plot Graph Output tab. Note color legend identifies risk pairs forest graph well p-value columns. incidence scatterplot, certain points also depicted larger green red points denotes statistically significant (per p value cutoff) lower higher incidence % respectively, treatment group vs control.

title: Adverse Events Tornado Plot
text: start, load required libraries -built example adae adsl dataset.
code: library(carver) library(dplyr) library(rlang) library(ggplot2)  data("adae") data("adsl")

what: Process Data with Subsets and Variables
title: Adverse Events Tornado Plot
text: creating Adverse Events tornado plot, ’s essential use process_tornado_data(). function helps prepare data visualization, making crucial step. function, users can customize many parts plot match specific data analysis needs. recommended used Oncology data, can also work non-Therapeutic Area specific ADaM datasets, shown example. function block consists mainly adsl_merge(), ae_pre_processor() mentry() functions combine ADSL variables, perform adverse-event specific pre-processing filter records/set grouping variables. also filters maximum severity based given inputs. , ’ll explain parameters used process_tornado_data:- dataset_adsl: parameter used pass variable containing ADSL dataset. dataset_analysis: parameter used pass variable containing analysis dataset. example, ADAE dataset. adsl_subset: parameter specifies subset condition(s) ADSL dataset. allows user filter data plotting. analysis_subset: Similar adsl_subset, parameter specifies subset condition(s) analysis dataset. split_by: parameter used splitting data specific variable. default value NA_character_ suggests default, ’s splitting. variable provided, split data accordingly. Example: Region - separate plots generated region. trtvar: parameter represents treatment variable. indicates variable represents different treatments groups data. trt_left: parameter represents treatment value. indicates value displays left hand side plot. trt_right: parameter represents treatment value. indicates value displays right hand side plot. trtsort: parameter used sorting treatment variable. obs_residual: parameter used pass period (numeric) extend observation period. passed NA, overall study duration considered analysis. eg. 5, events occurring upto 5 days past TRTEDT considered.. fmq_data: parameter required FMQ terms used high low terms, FMQ_Consolidated_List passed. Default value NULL. ae_catvar: parameter used series categorical variable severity analysis filter maximum severity. denom_subset: parameter condition used subset data set calculating denominator. Default value NA. pctdisp: parameter method used calculate denominator (%). Valid values: "TRT", "VAR", "COL", "SUBGRP", "CAT", "NONE", "", "DPTVAR", "BYVARxyN". legendbign: parameter determines whether N displayed legend. default value Y suggests default, N displayed legend. Default value N. yvar: parameter represents variable plotted y-axis. default value AESOC. NOTE: Default/Example values provided give users starting point. However, values can modified necessary better suit specific data visualization objectives. first step creating tornado_plot Adverse Events read required datasets environment. example, ADSL ADAE used. example calling process_tornado_data function preprocessing data tornado plot. process_tornado_data returns data.frame gets stored df . pre-processed dataset input Oncology tornado plot. df
code: df <- process_tornado_data(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   dataset_analysis = adae,   adsl_subset = "SAFFL == 'Y'",   analysis_subset = "TRTEMFL == 'Y'",   obs_residual = "30",   fmq_data = NA,   ae_catvar = "AESEV/AESEVN",   trtvar = "ARM",   trt_left = "Xanomeline High Dose",   trt_right = "Xanomeline Low Dose",   pctdisp = "TRT",   denom_subset = NA_character_,   legendbign = "N",   yvar = "AESOC" )

title: Adverse Events Tornado Plot
text: tornado_plot function designed create flipped bar plots input data, customizable options. offers flexibility plotting data allows users tailor plot aesthetics preferences. parameters used tornado_plot explained : datain: input data plotting. output data process_tornado_data function. trt_left_label: parameter used label trt_left plot. trt_right_label: parameter used label trt_right plot.. bar_width: Bar width option. parameter allows customization bar width displayed plot. axis_opts: List options axis appearance. parameter allows customization appearance x-axis y-axis, including labels, options retrieved plot_axis_opts(). legend_opts: List options legend appearance. parameter allows customization legend displayed plot, including label, position, direction. series_opts: Vector color options named ae_catvar variable severity analysis. griddisplay: Grid display option. parameter controls whether grid lines displayed plot. Set “N” disable grid lines, “Y” enable . example oncology tornado plot called using defined parameters:
code: series_opts <- g_seriescol(df, "red~yellow~blue", "BYVAR1")  plot <- tornado_plot(   df,   trt_left_label = "DRUG B",   trt_right_label = "DRUG C",   bar_width = 0.5,   axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(     xaxis_label = "Primary System Organ Class",     yaxis_label = "% of Subjects",     ylinearopts = list(       breaks = seq(-100, 100, 10),       labels = c(seq(100, 0, -10), seq(10, 100, 10))     )   ),   legend_opts = list(     label = "Severity",     pos = c(0.2, 0.15),     dir = "vertical"   ),   series_opts = series_opts,   griddisplay = "N" ) print(plot)

Report Type Figure Report Name Volcano Plot graph  Treatment/PopulationRequired Treatment Population Selection, select appropriate Treatment Variable: table, Treatment Variable determines columns Figure, determines differentiate groups color. Select appropriate Treatment Sort Variable give order sorting Treatment variable. subset entire data based population flags, select Population Filter. eg. Overall, Safety (SAFFL).  Processing Data: Add Edit default Analysis Subset Condition Denominator Subset Condition filter input data (calculating categorical counts alone entire data respectively)  Select Adverse Event Filter(s) - filter input data Select Period - generate figure either Overall Duration . Select Summary - helps select either Participants plot based subject count Events plot based AE counts. Select Lower Level Event Term - variable help generate figure AEBODSYS FMQ Name etc., type scatterplot shows statistical significance (P-value) versus magnitude change (fold change). Select Lower Level Event Term - variable help generate figure AEDECOD AELLT etc., type scatterplot shows statistical significance (P-value) versus magnitude change (fold change). select Measure Association - generate plot either Risk Ratio Risk Difference. Select Control Group - choose control treatment compare treatment Select Treatment Group - choose treatment compare control Update p Value Cutoff, Alpha Value(CI), Risk Reference Lines Cutoff Incidence (%) desired generate plot.  Graph Output: Click Process Report Input button switch Graph Output tab generate graph.

title: ADAE Summary with Risk Statistics — adae_risk_summary
text: datain Input data mentry() output get counts category a_subset Analysis Subset condition specific categorical analysis. summary_by Measure construct summary . Values: 'Patients' 'Events'. hterm High Level Adverse Event term variable, used analysis lterm Low Level Adverse Event term variable, used analysis ctrlgrp Treatment Control value. trtgrp Treatment(s) create pairs. 1 value Volcano/table, can multiple forest_plot(). statistics Statistic calculated. Values: 'Risk Ratio' 'Risk Difference'. riskdiff_pct display risk CI % statistic = risk difference (Y/N) alpha Alpha value determine confidence interval risk calculation. Default: 0.05 cutoff_where Filter condition incidence/pct. Consider terms eg: "FREQ > 5" "PCT <3". Must contain FREQ PCT (count percent) sort_opt sort terms, table/forest plot. Values: 'Ascending','Descending','Alphabetical'. sort_var Metric sort . Values: 'Count','Percent','RiskValue'. sum_row show summary/term row . 'Y'/'N' sum_row_label Label Summary Row displayed, Y. risklabels List containing labels table elements: risk, riskci, p, low, , lowup sigdec_cat Number decimal places % displayed output pctsyn Display Percentage Sign table . Values: "Y"/"N"

text: datain Input data mentry() output vars Names adsl variables display (Add "-S" numeric variables), tilde-separated stat_vars Statistics display table numeric vars, tilde-separated. pctdisp Method calculate denominator (%) . Possible values: "TRT", "VAR", "COL", "SUBGRP", "CAT", "NONE", "", "DPTVAR", "BYVARxyN" total_catyn return 'Total' row categories dptvar variable . Possible values: "Y"/"N" total_catlabel Label total category row. eg- ""/"Total" miss_catyn include empty/blank values miss_catlabel categories dptvar variable . Values: "Y"/"N" miss_catlabel Label missing values pctsyn Display Percentage Sign table . Values: "Y"/"N" sigdec_stat Number base decimal places retain output summary statistic. Applies mean, min, max, sd etc sigdec_cat Number decimal places % displayed output a_subset Analysis Subset condition; tilde-separated variable vars. denom_subset Subset condition applied dataset calculating denominator, tilde-separated categorical variables within vars. sparseyn sparse missing categories/treatments ? "Y"/"N" sparsebyvalyn Sparse missing categories within groups. "Y"/"N"

title: Demographic Characteristics Table — adsl_summary
text: data.frame passed tbl_processor tbl_display

title: Demographic Characteristics Table — adsl_summary
text: vars contain variables analysis "-S" added numeric/summary stat variables, remaining categorical analysis. eg. "AGEGR1/AGEGR1N~AGE-S~SEX/SEXN~BMIBL-S", AGEGR1 SEX analysed category AGE BMIBL summary statistics. Argument stat_vars contain names statistic apply summary analysis variables. sigdec applies statistical analysis numeric variables (-S) Arguments pctdisp, total_catyn, miss_catyn, miss_catlabel apply variables categorical analyses. a_subset tilde-separated subset conditions, corresponding variable vars. Length 1 number variables vars. 1 condition given, apply variables. denom_subset, commonly used pctdisp "SUBGRP" "DPTVAR" corresponds categorical variables within vars. eg. "AGEGR1~AGE-S~SEX~BMIBL-S", 2 tilde-separated conditions like "!.na(USUBJID)~!.na(SITEID)". 1 condition given, apply categorical/discrete variables.

what: Forest Plot of Adverse Events — ae_forest_plot
title: Forest Plot of Adverse Events — ae_forest_plot
text: ae_forest_plot() takes arguments displaying Risk counts data (risk_stat()) form forest plot elements - list AE terms corresponding scatter plot, forest risk statistics p-values according treatment pair.

title: Forest Plot of Adverse Events — ae_forest_plot
code: ae_forest_plot(   datain,   series_opts,   trtpair_color = rep("black", 10),   axis_opts,   term_label = "",   risk_ref = 1,   ht_dispyn = "N",   pvalue_dispyn = "Y",   text_size = 2.4,   highlight_sig = "N",   pvalue_sig = 0.05,   pairwise = "N",   terms_perpg = NULL,   rel_widths = c(0.55, 0.35, 0.1),   interactive = "N" )

title: Forest Plot of Adverse Events — ae_forest_plot
text: datain Input data risk_stat() output, used plotting series_opts Series Variable styling options, list containing shape, color size; applicable percent scatter plot TRTVAR series variable trtpair_color Series colors treatment pair statistic (.e. error bars risk plot p-value table) axis_opts list axis specific options retrieved plot_axis_opts(); applied primarily plot risk statistics term_label X axis label display list AE terms. risk_ref X intercept Value draw vertical reference line risk plot ht_dispyn Display column Event High Term corresponding events. Values: "Y"/"N" pvalue_dispyn Display column(s) p-value corresponding term. Values: "Y"/"N" text_size Size text AE terms well p-values Used ht_dispynand/pvalue_dispyn = Y. highlight_sig highlight points scatter plot significant differences reflected percentage per treatment/event? Values: "Y"/"N" pvalue_sig p value cutoff determine display significant differences control treatment, highlight_sig = "Y" pairwise Split plot 1 treatment pair per page? Values: "Y"/"N". N, pairs displayed together. terms_perpg Number AE terms display per page. NULL, terms shown. rel_widths Relative Widths sub-plot order: High Term (optional)~Percent Scatter Plot~Risk Plot~p value table (optional). Number values change per number subplots, total equal 1. eg; c(0.25, 0.38, 0.27, 0.10)/"0.25~0.38~0.27~0.1", ht_dispyn pvalues_dispyn = Y. eg. ht_dispyn =  Y; "0.2~0.45~0.35" pvalue_dispyn = Y, c(0.45, 0.35, 0.2) interactive Return interactive plot (ggplotly)? Values: "Y"/"N"

title: Forest Plot of Adverse Events — ae_forest_plot
code: data("adae") ae_pre <- ae_pre_processor(   datain = adae,   obs_residual = 0,   fmq_data = NA ) ae_entry <- mentry(   datain = ae_pre$data,   subset = NA,   byvar = "AEBODSYS",   trtvar = "TRTA",   trtsort = "TRTAN",   subgrpvar = NA,   trttotalyn = "N",   add_grpmiss = "N",   sgtotalyn = "N",   pop_fil = "SAFFL" ) ae_risk_forest <- risk_stat(   datain = ae_entry,   a_subset = ae_pre$a_subset,   summary_by = "Patients",   eventvar = "AEDECOD",   ctrlgrp = "Placebo",   trtgrp = "Xanomeline High Dose",   statistics = "Risk Ratio",   alpha = 0.05,   cutoff_where = "FREQ >5",   sort_opt = "Ascending",   sort_var = "Count" ) |>   plot_display_bign(     ae_entry,     bignyn = "Y"   ) #> mcatstat success  ae_forest_plot(   datain = ae_risk_forest,   series_opts = plot_aes_opts(     datain = ae_risk_forest,     series_color = c("black", "royalblue2"),     series_size = rep(1, 5)   ),   axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(     xaxis_label = "Risk Ratio",     xopts = list(labelsize = 8)   ),   text_size = 2.4,   term_label = "Reported Term for the Adverse Event",   risk_ref = 1,   highlight_sig = "N" )[[1]] #> Warning: Ignoring unknown parameters: `linewidth`

code: ae_pre_processor(   datain,   fmq_data = NULL,   date_vars = c("ASTDT", "AENDT", "TRTSDT", "TRTEDT"),   ae_filter = "Any Event",   subset = NA,   obs_residual = NA_real_,   max_sevctc = NA_character_,   sev_ctcvar = "ASEVN",   hterm = "AEBODSYS",   lterm = "AEDECOD",   rpt_byvar = character(0),   trtvar = "TRTA",   pt_total = "N" )

title: Pre-processing data for Adverse Event domain specific reports — ae_pre_processor
text: datain input ADaM (ADAE) dataset. fmq_data FMQ table dataframe, passed, merged adae date PT. date_vars Vector variables converted R date format ae_filter Vector adverse event types used filter conditions. Permissible Values: "", "EVENT", "TREATMENT EMERGENT", "SERIOUS", "DRUG-RELATED", "RELATED", "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE", "RECOVERED/RESOLVED", "RECOVERING/RESOLVING", "RECOVERING/RESOLVING", "FATAL", "GRADE N" subset Analysis subset condition applied ADAE dataset prior ADSL join; appended ae_filter obs_residual NA, use argument pass period (numeric) extend observation period. passed NA, overall study duration considered analysis. eg. 5, events occurring upto 5 days past TRTEDT considered. max_sevctc needed filter maximum severity/ctc grade rows. Values: NA/"SEV"/"CTC" sev_ctcvar Variable determine max severity. eg: ASEVN, ATOXGRN hterm High Level Event Term (req max Sev tables ) lterm Low Level Event Term (req max Sev tables ) rpt_byvar Page/report variable , identify max sev/ctc trtvar Treatment Variable pt_total Required calculate total preferred terms? Y/N

title: Generate Volcano Plot of Adverse Events from Risk values of treatment pairs — ae_volcano_plot
code: data("adae")  ae_pre <- ae_pre_processor(   datain = adae,   obs_residual = 0,   fmq_data = NA )  ae_entry <- mentry(   datain = ae_pre$data,   subset = NA,   byvar = "AEBODSYS",   trtvar = "TRTA",   trtsort = "TRTAN",   subgrpvar = NA,   trttotalyn = "N",   add_grpmiss = "N",   sgtotalyn = "N",   pop_fil = "SAFFL" )  ae_risk <- risk_stat(   datain = ae_entry,   a_subset = ae_pre$a_subset,   summary_by = "Patients",   eventvar = "AEDECOD",   ctrlgrp = "Placebo",   trtgrp = "Xanomeline High Dose",   statistics = "Risk Ratio",   alpha = 0.05,   cutoff_where = "FREQ >5",   sort_opt = "Ascending",   sort_var = "Count" ) #> mcatstat success  vaxis_opts <- ae_volcano_opts(   ae_risk,   "Control",   "Exposure",   pvalue_trans = "-log10" )  axis_opts <- plot_axis_opts(   ylinearopts = vaxis_opts$ylinearopts,   yaxis_scale = vaxis_opts$yaxis_scale,   xaxis_label = vaxis_opts$xaxis_label,   yaxis_label = vaxis_opts$yaxis_label )  ae_risk |>   ae_volcano_plot(     axis_opts = axis_opts,     xref = vaxis_opts$xref   )

title: Create box plot - static and interactive output — box_plot
text: function utilises data processing steps create boxplot. Statistics required: msumstat() function prior, statvar c("median", "q25", "q75", "sd", "whiskerlow", "whiskerup", ystat) "box" ystat representing additional statistic calculated/plotted points. series_labvar can , eg "TRTTXT" variable contains modified labels series_var ("TRTVAR") shown legend color , shape, size elements series_opts length less number levels/unique values variable series_var - recommended get plot_aes_opts()

title: Create box plot - static and interactive output — box_plot
code: data(adsl)  adsl_entry <- mentry(   datain = adsl,   subset = "EFFFL=='Y'",   byvar = "RACE",   trtvar = "TRT01A",   trtsort = "TRT01AN",   pop_fil = NA )  adsl_sum <- msumstat(   datain = adsl_entry,   dptvar = "AGE",   statvar = c(     "mean", "median", "q25", "q75", "whiskerlow",     "whiskerup"   ) )[["gsum"]] |>   plot_display_bign(adsl_entry) |>   dplyr::mutate(XVAR = BYVAR1) #> msum success  series_opts <- adsl_sum |>   plot_aes_opts(     series_color = c("red", "gold", "cyan"),     series_shape = c(16, 17, 15),     series_size = c(1, 1, 1)   )  box_plot(   datain = adsl_sum,   axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(),   legend_opts = list(     label = "Treatment", pos = "bottom",     dir = "horizontal"   ),   series_opts = series_opts,   plot_title = "Age distribution over Race groups" ) #> Warning: There were 6 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `across(all_of(c(ystat, "median", "q25", "q75", whiskers)), #>   as.numeric)`. #> Caused by warning: #> ! NAs introduced by coercion #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 5 remaining warnings. #> Box Plot Success #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_segment()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_segment()`). #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_segment()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_segment()`). #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: eDISH Plot — edish_plot
code: data("adlb") data("adsl")  merged_data <- adsl_merge(   adsl = adsl,   dataset_add = adlb ) |>   mentry(     subset = "SAFFL == 'Y'",     trtvar = "TRT01A",     trtsort = "TRT01AN"   )  pt_data <- process_edish_data(   datain = merged_data,   xvar = "both",   alt_paramcd = "ALT",   ast_paramcd = "AST",   bili_paramcd = "BILI" )  series_opts <- plot_aes_opts(pt_data,   series_color = NA,   series_shape = "circlefilled~trianglefilled",   series_size = c(1.5, 1.5) ) edish_plot(   datain = pt_data,   axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(     xlinearopts = list(       breaks = c(0.1, 1, 2, 5),       limits = c(0.1, 5),       labels = c("0.1", "1", "2x ULN", "5")     ),     ylinearopts = list(       breaks = c(0.1, 1, 3, 10),       limits = c(0.1, 10),       labels = c("0.1", "1", "3x ULN", "10")     )   ),   xrefline = c("2", "gray30", "dashed"),   yrefline = c("3", "gray30", "dashed"),   quad_labels =     "Potential Hy's Law Cases~Temple's Corollary~Gilberts Syndrome or Cholestasis~Normal",   legend_opts = list(     label = "Treatment",     pos = "bottom", dir = "horizontal"   ),   series_opts = series_opts,   plot_title = NULL,   interactive = "N" )

title: Display combined Forest Plot — forest_display
text: plot_list Named list ggplot objects combined. Must contain names "splot" (scatter plot), "fplot" (risk/forest plot) optionally may include "ptable" (p-values/statistic) /"termtable" (terms/categories) rel_widths Relative widths subplot - applied static interactive plot interactive Return interactive subplot object? Alternatively, grid plot returned. Values: "Y"/"N" plot_height Height plotly output, specifically required xpos X xaxis splot fplot displayed interactive plot? Values: "top"/"bottom". Value static output decided prior passing function. legend_opts Legend styling option, list containing pos(position) dir (direction).

title: Display combined Forest Plot — forest_display
text: plot_grid object plotly forest plot object

title: Display combined Forest Plot — forest_display
code:
data("adae") ae_pre_process <- ae_pre_processor( datain = adae, obs_residual = 0 ) ae_entry <- mentry( datain = ae_pre_process$data, byvar = "AEBODSYS", trtvar = "TRTA", trtsort = "TRTAN", pop_fil = "SAFFL" ) ae_risk <- risk_stat( datain = ae_entry, a_subset = ae_pre_process$a_subset, summary_by = "Patients", eventvar = "AEDECOD", ctrlgrp = "Placebo", trtgrp = "Xanomeline High Dose", statistics = "Risk Ratio", alpha = 0.05, cutoff_where = "PCT > 2", hoveryn = "Y" ) |> dplyr::mutate(key = dplyr::row_number()) #> mcatstat success splot <- forest_plot_scatter( datain = ae_risk, xvar = "PCT", yvar = "DPTVAL", series_var = "TRTVAR", series_opts = list( color = g_seriescol(ae_risk, c("black", "forestgreen"), "TRTVAR"), shape = g_seriessym(ae_risk, NA, "TRTVAR"), size = rep(1, 2) ), hovervar = "HOVER_TEXT", xaxis_pos = "top", legend_opts = list(pos = "bottom", dir = "horizontal"), axis_opts = list(xsize = 8, xtsize = 6, xaxis_label = "Percentage") ) fplot <- forest_plot_base( ae_risk, xvar = "RISK", yvar = "DPTVAL", xminvar = "RISKCIL", xmaxvar = "RISKCIU", hovervar = "HOVER_TEXT", series_var = "TRTPAIR", xrefline = 1, axis_opts = plot_axis_opts( xaxis_label = "Risk Ratio", xopts = list(labelsize = 8) ) ) #> Warning: Ignoring unknown parameters: `linewidth` forest_display(list(splot = splot, fplot = fplot), rel_widths = c(0.6, 0.4) ) #> Warning: Removed 10 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_errorbarh()`). #> Warning: Removed 10 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_errorbarh()`). forest_display(list(splot = splot, fplot = fplot), rel_widths = c(0.6, 0.4), interactive = "Y" ) what: Forest Plot - base with errorbars — forest_plot_base
title: Forest Plot - base with errorbars — forest_plot_base
text: Forest Plot - base errorbars

title: Forest Plot - base with errorbars — forest_plot_base
code: forest_plot_base(   datain,   xvar = "RISK",   yvar = "DPTVAL",   xminvar = "RISKCIL",   xmaxvar = "RISKCIU",   hovervar = "HOVER_RISK",   series_var = "TRTPAIR",   series_color = c("black", "black"),   xrefline = 1,   xaxis_pos = "top",   legend_opts = list(pos = "bottom", dir = "horizontal"),   hline_y = "Y",   axis_opts )

title: Forest Plot - base with errorbars — forest_plot_base
text: datain Input dataset, pre-processed. xvar X-axis variable (continuous) yvar Y-axis variable (discrete) xminvar Min. x value errorbar (usually lower limit Confidence Interval) xmaxvar Max. x value errorbar (usually upper limit Confidence Interval) hovervar Variable containing tooltip info (interactive plot) series_var Series Variable (stratify ). series_color Vector colors series variable xrefline X-intercept value vertical reference line xaxis_pos Position X axis title. Values: "top"/"bottom" legend_opts Legend styling option, list containing pos(position) dir (direction). hline_y Horizontal line marking Y variable plotted ? "Y"/"N" axis_opts list axis specific options, usually retrieved plot_axis_opts(). Following elements - xaxis_label, xaxis_scale, Xlims, Xbrks, xsize, xtsize utilised required list.

title: Forest Plot - base with errorbars — forest_plot_base
text: ggplot statistic interval bars.

title: Forest Plot - base with errorbars — forest_plot_base
code: data("adae") ae_pre_process <- ae_pre_processor(   datain = adae,   obs_residual = 0 )  ae_entry <- mentry(   datain = ae_pre_process$data,   byvar = "AEBODSYS",   trtvar = "TRTA",   trtsort = "TRTAN",   pop_fil = "SAFFL" )  ae_risk <- risk_stat(   datain = ae_entry,   a_subset = ae_pre_process$a_subset,   summary_by = "Patients",   eventvar = "AEDECOD",   ctrlgrp = "Placebo",   trtgrp = "Xanomeline High Dose",   statistics = "Risk Ratio",   alpha = 0.05,   cutoff_where = "PCT > 2",   hoveryn = "Y" ) |>   dplyr::mutate(key = dplyr::row_number()) #> mcatstat success forest_plot_base(   ae_risk,   xvar = "RISK",   yvar = "DPTVAL",   xminvar = "RISKCIL",   xmaxvar = "RISKCIU",   hovervar = "HOVER_TEXT",   series_var = "TRTPAIR",   xrefline = 1,   axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(     xaxis_label = "Risk Ratio",     xopts = list(labelsize = 8)   ) ) #> Warning: Ignoring unknown parameters: `linewidth` #> Warning: Removed 10 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_errorbarh()`).

what: Scatter plot to be included within forest plot — forest_plot_scatter
title: Scatter plot to be included within forest plot — forest_plot_scatter
text: Scatter plot included within forest plot

title: Scatter plot to be included within forest plot — forest_plot_scatter
code: forest_plot_scatter(   datain,   xvar = "PCT",   yvar = "DPTVAL",   series_var = "TRTVAR",   series_labelvar = series_var,   series_opts,   hovervar = "HOVER_PCT",   xaxis_pos = "top",   legend_opts = list(pos = "bottom", dir = "horizontal"),   hline_y = "Y",   axis_opts = list(xsize = 8, xtsize = 6, xaxis_label = "Percentage") )

title: Scatter plot to be included within forest plot — forest_plot_scatter
text: datain Input dataset, pre-processed. xvar X-axis variable (continuous) yvar Y-axis variable (discrete) series_var Series Variable (stratify ). series_labelvar Series (Treatment) Variable labels legend, different series_var. needed, series_labelvar factor variable levels corresponding series_var, also factor. series_opts Series Variable styling options, list containing shape, color size. hovervar Variable containing tooltip info (interactive plot) xaxis_pos Position X axis title. Values: "top"/"bottom" legend_opts Legend styling option, list containing pos(position) dir (direction). hline_y Horizontal line marking Y variable plotted ? "Y"/"N" axis_opts list axis specific options. following elements - xaxis_label, xsize, xtsize utilised required list. eg. list(xaxis_label = "Percentage", xsize = 8, xtsize = 6)

title: Scatter plot to be included within forest plot — forest_plot_scatter
text: ggplot scatterplot, fit combining forest plot.

title: Scatter plot to be included within forest plot — forest_plot_scatter
code: data("adae") ae_pre_process <- ae_pre_processor(   datain = adae,   obs_residual = 0 )  ae_entry <- mentry(   datain = ae_pre_process$data,   byvar = "AEBODSYS",   trtvar = "TRTA",   trtsort = "TRTAN",   pop_fil = "SAFFL" )  ae_risk <- risk_stat(   datain = ae_entry,   a_subset = ae_pre_process$a_subset,   summary_by = "Patients",   eventvar = "AEDECOD",   ctrlgrp = "Placebo",   trtgrp = "Xanomeline High Dose",   statistics = "Risk Ratio",   alpha = 0.05,   cutoff_where = "PCT > 2",   hoveryn = "Y" ) |>   dplyr::mutate(key = dplyr::row_number()) #> mcatstat success forest_plot_scatter(   datain = ae_risk,   xvar = "PCT",   yvar = "DPTVAL",   series_var = "TRTVAR",   series_opts = list(     color = g_seriescol(ae_risk, c("black", "forestgreen"), "TRTVAR"),     shape = g_seriessym(ae_risk, NA, "TRTVAR"),     size = rep(1, 2)   ),   hovervar = "HOVER_TEXT",   xaxis_pos = "top" )

what: Summary analysis for categorical variables — mcatstat
title: Summary analysis for categorical variables — mcatstat
text: mcatstat() returns new dataframe containing counts percentages categorical analysis variable according grouping treatment variables passed mentry()

title: Summary analysis for categorical variables — mcatstat
code: mcatstat(   datain = NULL,   a_subset = NA_character_,   denom_subset = NA_character_,   uniqid = "USUBJID",   dptvar = NULL,   pctdisp = "TRT",   miss_catyn = "N",   miss_catlabel = "Missing",   cum_ctyn = "N",   total_catyn = "N",   total_catlabel = "Total",   dptvarn = 1,   pctsyn = "Y",   sigdec = 2,   denomyn = "N",   sparseyn = "N",   sparsebyvalyn = "N",   return_zero = "N" )

title: Summary analysis for categorical variables — mcatstat
text: datain Input data mentry() output get counts category a_subset Analysis Subset condition specific categorical analysis. denom_subset Subset condition applied data set calculating denominator. uniqid Variable(s) calculate unique counts . eg. "USUBJID", "SITEID", "ALLCT" dptvar Categorical Analysis variable ordering variable exists, separated /. eg: "SEX", "SEX/SEXN", "AEDECOD", "ISTPT/ISTPTN" pctdisp Method calculate denominator (%) . Possible values: "TRT", "VAR", "COL", "SUBGRP", "CAT", "NONE", "", "DPTVAR", "BYVARxyN" miss_catyn include empty/blank values miss_catlabel categories dptvar variable . Values: "Y"/"N" miss_catlabel Label missing values cum_ctyn return cumulative frequency instead individual frequencies category. Values: "Y"/"N" total_catyn return 'Total' row categories dptvar variable . Possible values: "Y"/"N" total_catlabel Label total category row. eg- ""/"Total" dptvarn Number assign DPTVARN, useful block sorting multiple mcatstat() outputs created combined. pctsyn Display Percentage Sign table . Values: "Y"/"N" sigdec Number decimal places % displayed output denomyn Display denominator output . Values: "Y"/"N" sparseyn sparse missing categories/treatments ? "Y"/"N" sparsebyvalyn Sparse missing categories within groups. "Y"/"N" return_zero Return rows zero counts analysis subset/ non-missing exist data. "Y"/"N"

title: Summary analysis for categorical variables — mcatstat
text: data.frame counts /percentages, passed passed tbl_processor() graph functions

title: Summary analysis for categorical variables — mcatstat
text: Object passed datain return element mentry() a_subset condition applied data analysed, applied getting denominator denom_subset condition, given, apply denominator data alone. Usually used pctdisp = "SUBGRP" "DPTVAR" uniqid variable name get unique counts . given "ALLCT", sums observations given category. "USUBJID" calculates number unique subjects per category. cum_ctyn "Y" get output value cumulative frequencies instead individual frequencies. "Y", total_catyn reset "N" pctdisp possible values method get denominator calculate percentage: NONE/: percent calculation TRT: Treatment total counts acts denominator VAR: Variable Total treatments/groups acts denominator COL: Column wise denominator - percentage within Treatment-Subgroup(s) combination CAT: Row-wise denominator - percentage within Bygroup(s)-dptvar combination SUBGRP: Percentage within Treatment-group(s)-Subgroup(s) combination DPTVAR: Percentage within Treatment-group(s)-Subgroup(s)-dptvar combination. BYVARxyN: Percentage using Treatment-Bygroup combination denominator. eg BYVAR12N uses TRT-BYVAR1-BYVAR2 combination, BYVAR1N TRT-BYVAR1 SGRPN: Percentage using Subgroup total denominator

title: Summary analysis for categorical variables — mcatstat

what: Read and process data with subsets and variables — mentry
title: Read and process data with subsets and variables — mentry
text: input data gets processed based TRT, /SUBGROUP variables filtered subset conditions. processed data flows categorical numerical utilities mcatstat() msumstat() analysis.

title: Read and process data with subsets and variables — mentry
code: mentry(   datain,   subset = NA,   byvar = NA,   subgrpvar = NA,   trtvar = NA,   trtsort = NA,   trttotalyn = "N",   trttotlabel = "Total",   trtmissyn = "N",   sgtotalyn = "N",   add_grpmiss = "N",   pop_fil = "Overall Population" )

title: Read and process data with subsets and variables — mentry
text: datain Input dataset can ADaM data. subset Subset conditions analysis dependent variable. byvar Tilde(~) separated strings grouping variable names. Assigns BYVAR1, BYVAR2, etc. Use '/' specify ordering variables. eg: SEX/SEXN~COUNTRY.` subgrpvar Tilde(~) separated strings grouping variable names. Assigns SUBGRPVAR1, SUBGRPVAR2, etc. Use '/' specify ordering variables. eg: RACE/RACEN~ETHNIC. trtvar Treatment variable name string assigned TRTVAR. trtsort Treatment sorting variable name string - numeric character variable assigned TRTSORT. trttotalyn Add total treatment values displayed column table category plot ("Y"/"N"). trttotlabel Label total Treatment column/group trtmissyn Retain Missing treatment counts Total (trttotalyn = Y). Missing treatment considered column analysis case. sgtotalyn Add total subgroup values displayed column table category plot ("Y"/"N"). add_grpmiss Add row column missing category grouping variables. ("Y"/"N") pop_fil Population Filter data set: Name flag variable. eg: "SAFFL", "EFFFL" NA Overall Population.

title: Read and process data with subsets and variables — mentry
text: data.frame output used utilities applied subset

title: Read and process data with subsets and variables — mentry
text: Variable Processing Identify byvars byvar given, create BYVAR1, BYVAR2, etc. Check numeric code list variable grouping var, create numeric variable sorting BYVAR1N, BYVAR2N etc. Convert character numeric. Re-code blanks grouping variables "Missing" Remove missing category value grouping variable per user choice. Treatment Variable Processing Identify Treatment Variable, treatment sorting variable. Remove non treatment values. treatment sort variable exist, make TRTVAR treatment sort numeric, convert numeric Add treatment total column based trttotalyn Convert TRTVAR factor order TRTSORT Subgroup Variable processing Identify Subgroup variable: create SUBGRPVAR1N, SUBGRPVAR2N etc subgrpvar specified. Check presence numeric code list variables subgroup variables, create numeric variable sorting purpose SUBGRPVAR1N etc Re-code blanks Subgroup vars Missing Remove missing category value grouping variable per user choice Add Subgroup total column last subgroup variable Subset Processing Applying population subset selected Applying denominator/overall subset condition passed user Applying analysis subset condition passed user Calculate Big N displaying final output data.frame Count N treatment/subgroup exist. title: Summary statistics for numeric data variable — msumstat
text: datain Input dataset mentry() a_subset Analysis subset condition specific function. dptvar Numerical variable analysis. eg: "AGE", "HEIGHTBL" statvar Tilde (~)-separated list statistics computed. eg: "mean~median" sigdec Number base decimal places retain output Applies mean, min, max, sd etc dptvarn Number assign 'DPTVARN', used block sorting multiple blocks created combined. sparsebyvalyn Sparse missing categories within groups. "Y"/"N" figyn Determine output figure "Y"/"N"

title: Summary statistics for numeric data variable — msumstat
text: list containing 2 elements tsum - Dataset statistics rows, table output gsum - Dataset statistics columns, plot output

title: Summary statistics for numeric data variable — msumstat
text: Current available statistics (values statvar) : n (count per group), mean, median, sd (standard deviation), min, max, iqr (interquartile range), var (variance), sum, range ("min, max") mean(sd), median(minmax), q25/q1 (25 % quantile), q75/q3 (75 % quantile) , p10 (10% quantile), p5, p1, p90, p95, p99, q1q3 ("q25, q75"), whiskerlow, whiskerup (box lower/upper whiskers), outliers (boxplot outliers, tilde-separated output), geometric mean/sd/CI box = median~q25~q75~whiskerlow~whiskerup~outliers (Tukey's method)

title: Generic Occurrence Summary Tiered Table — occ_tier_summary
code: occ_tier_summary(   datain,   a_subset = NA_character_,   summary_by = "Patients",   hterm = "AEBODSYS",   lterm = "AEDECOD",   htermctyn = "Y",   pctdisp = "TRT",   cutoff_where = NA,   sum_row = "N",   sum_row_label = "Number of Participants with Any AE",   apply_hrow_cutoff = "N",   sort_opt = "Ascending",   sort_var = "Count",   sort_col = 1,   nolwrtierdispyn = "N",   sigdec_cat = 2,   pctsyn = "Y",   stathead = "n (%)" )

title: Generic Occurrence Summary Tiered Table — occ_tier_summary
text: datain Input dataset (generally output mentry()) a_subset Analysis Subset condition specific categorical analysis. summary_by Measure construct summary . Values: 'Patients' 'Events'. hterm High Level Event term variable, used analysis (tilde-separated) lterm Low Level Event term variable, used analysis htermctyn show count high term rows . correspond number terms passed hterm (tilde-separated). suppress showing counts term pass "N" pctdisp Method calculate denominator (%) . Possible values: "TRT", "VAR", "COL", "SUBGRP", "CAT", "NONE", "", "DPTVAR", "BYVARxyN" cutoff_where Filter condition incidence/pct. Consider terms eg: "FREQ > 5" "PCT <3". Must contain FREQ PCT (count percent) sum_row show summary/term row . 'Y'/'N' sum_row_label Label Summary Row displayed, Y. apply_hrow_cutoff apply cutoff_where value high terms addition low term. set "Y" cutoff applied remove  high low level terms meet criteria. set "N" (default), cutoff applied Lower Level term. terms fit criteria excluded counts High Level term. happen case "N" - low terms included high term displayed long meets criteria well. sort_opt sort terms, table/forest plot. Values: 'Ascending','Descending','Alphabetical'. sort_var Metric sort . Values: 'Count','Percent','RiskValue'. sort_col treatment column sort . (Depends trt levels) eg: 1, 2, 3 nolwrtierdispyn Whenapply_hrow_cutoff = Y, display high level terms zero low level terms satisfying cutoff threshold ? Y, high terms displayed even corresponding lower levels table. sigdec_cat Number decimal places % displayed output pctsyn Display Percentage Sign table . Values: "Y"/"N" stathead Label sub-column header output. eg. "n (%)"

title: Generic Occurrence Summary Tiered Table — occ_tier_summary
text: Summarized data frame Adverse Events based high lower terms.

title: Generic Occurrence Summary Tiered Table — occ_tier_summary
text: cutoff_where applied event lower term , unless apply_hrow_cutoff given. apply_hrow_cutoff Y, cutoff_where applied higher terms well. N, lower terms meet criteria removed higher term count. eg: cutoff_where set "PCT >= 2" hterm lterm AEBODSYS AEDECOD: EYE DISORDERS         9 (3.1) Dry eye        3 (1.4) Wet eye        6 (2.4) apply_hrow_cutoff set N 'Dry eye' row excluded 3 excluded count EYE DISORDERS well (9). Y, 'Dry eye' excluded EYE DISORDERS impacted 4.4% PCT >= 2. cutoff_where PCT >= 3 nolwrtierdispyn set Y, neither Dry eye Wet eye shown, EYE DISORDERS still displayed. nolwrtierdispyn N case, EYE DISORDERS also removed low terms meet criteria.

title: Generic Occurrence Summary Tiered Table — occ_tier_summary

    trtvar = "TRTA",     trtsort = "TRTAN",     trttotalyn = "N",     add_grpmiss = "N",     sgtotalyn = "N",     pop_fil = "Overall Population"   ) output <- occ_tier_summary(   ae_entry,   a_subset = ae_pre_process[["a_subset"]],   summary_by = "Patients",   hterm = "AEBODSYS",   lterm = "AEDECOD",   pctdisp = "TRT",   cutoff_where = "PCT > 2",   apply_hrow_cutoff = "N",   sort_opt = "Ascending",   sort_var = "Count" ) #> mcatstat success #> mcatstat success output |>   tbl_processor() |>   tbl_display() text: series_shape argument can take numeric values c(16, 25, 22), "16,25,22" characters - c("triangle", "square")/"triangle,square"

title: Set Series Variable Options for color, shape and size — plot_aes_opts
code: plot_aes_opts(iris,   series_var = "Species",   series_color = NA,   series_shape = "trianglefilled~circlefilled~squarefilled~asterisk",   series_size = c(2, 2, 2, 2),   series_contrast = "black~black~black" ) #> $color #>        setosa    versicolor     virginica  #>  "firebrick2"       "blue4" "forestgreen"  #>  #> $shape #>     setosa versicolor  virginica  #>         17         16         15  #>  #> $size #>     setosa versicolor  virginica  #>          2          2          2  #>  #> $contrast #>     setosa versicolor  virginica  #>    "black"    "black"    "black"  #>

title: Return N count in plot legend (treatment) — plot_display_bign
code: data(adsl) adsl_entry <- adsl |>   mentry(     trtvar = "TRT01A",     trtsort = "TRT01AN",     trttotalyn = "N",     add_grpmiss = "N",     pop_fil = "SAFFL"   ) msumstat(   adsl_entry,   dptvar = "AGE",   statvar = "mean" )$gsum |>   plot_display_bign(adsl_entry) #> msum success #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   TRTVAR               mean  DPTVAR CN    DPTVARN TRTTXT                      #>   <ord>                <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <dbl> <fct>                       #> 1 Placebo              75.21 AGE    N           1 Placebo (N=86)              #> 2 Xanomeline Low Dose  75.67 AGE    N           1 Xanomeline Low Dose (N=84)  #> 3 Xanomeline High Dose 74.38 AGE    N           1 Xanomeline High Dose (N=84)

title: Legend Positioning and Labeling for an interactive Plot — plotly_legend

title: Legend Positioning and Labeling for an interactive Plot — plotly_legend

title: Pre-process data for tornado plot — process_tornado_data
code: process_tornado_data(   dataset_adsl,   dataset_analysis,   adsl_subset = NA_character_,   analysis_subset = NA_character_,   obs_residual = NA_real_,   ae_filter = "Any Event",   pop_fil = NA_character_,   fmq_data = NULL,   split_by = NA_character_,   ae_catvar,   trtvar,   trt_left,   trt_right,   trtsort = NA_character_,   subset = NA_character_,   pctdisp = "TRT",   denom_subset = NA_character_,   legendbign = "N",   yvar = "AESOC" )

title: Pre-process data for tornado plot — process_tornado_data
text: dataset_adsl (data.frame) ADSL dataset. dataset_analysis (data.frame) ADAE dataset. adsl_subset (string) Subset condition applied dataset_adsl. analysis_subset Subset conditions dataset_analysis obs_residual NA, use argument pass period (numeric) extend observation period. passed NA, overall study duration considered analysis. eg. 5, events occurring upto 5 days past TRTEDT considered. ae_filter Vector adverse event types used filter conditions. Permissible Values: "", "EVENT", "TREATMENT EMERGENT", "SERIOUS", "DRUG-RELATED", "RELATED", "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE", "RECOVERED/RESOLVED", "RECOVERING/RESOLVING", "RECOVERING/RESOLVING", "FATAL", "GRADE N" pop_fil Population Filter data set: Name flag variable. eg: "SAFFL", "EFFFL" NA Overall Population. fmq_data FMQ table dataframe, passed, merged adae date PT. split_by (string) variable stratification. ae_catvar Categorical variable severity analysis order variable. eg; "ASEV/ASEVN" trtvar (string) Treatment Variable created analysis. trt_left Treatment value displaying left hand side plot. trt_right Treatment value displaying right hand side plot. trtsort (string) Variable sort treatment variable . subset Overall subset data set. eg: "EFFFL == 'Y'" eg: "SAFFL", "EFFFL" NA Overall Population. pctdisp Method calculate denominator (%) Possible values: "TRT","VAR","COL","SUBGRP","CAT","NONE","","DPTVAR" denom_subset Subset condition applied data set calculating denominator. legendbign (string) Display BIGN Legend (Y/N). yvar Categorical Analysis variable Y axis

title: Pre-process data for tornado plot — process_tornado_data
text: mcatstat dataset data frame.

title: Pre-process data for tornado plot — process_tornado_data
text: ae_catvar grouping variable severity like AESEV(MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE). must passed "/" separated numeric variable. eg: ASEV/ASEVN; ATOXGR/ATOXGRN yvar(dptvar) Adverse Event category, derived term AE. Possible Values: AEBODSYS, AEDECOD, AEHLT, AEHLGT.

code: risk_stat(   datain,   a_subset = NA_character_,   summary_by = "Patients",   eventvar,   ctrlgrp,   trtgrp,   statistics = "Risk Ratio",   alpha = 0.05,   cutoff_where = NA,   sort_opt = "Ascending",   sort_var = "Count",   g_sort_by_ht = "N",   riskdiff_pct = "N",   sigdec = 1,   pctsyn = "Y",   hoveryn = "Y" )

title: Calculate Risk Statistics for treatment pairs from pre-processed Adverse Events data — risk_stat
text: datain Input data mentry() output get counts category a_subset Analysis Subset condition specific categorical analysis. summary_by Measure construct summary . Values: 'Patients' 'Events'. eventvar Event Variable review . Example: 'AEDECOD', 'AEBODSYS'. ctrlgrp Treatment Control value. trtgrp Treatment(s) create pairs. 1 value Volcano/table, can multiple forest_plot(). statistics Statistic calculated. Values: 'Risk Ratio' 'Risk Difference'. alpha Alpha value determine confidence interval risk calculation. Default: 0.05 cutoff_where Filter condition incidence/pct. Consider terms eg: "FREQ > 5" "PCT <3". Must contain FREQ PCT (count percent) sort_opt sort terms, table/forest plot. Values: 'Ascending','Descending','Alphabetical'. sort_var Metric sort . Values: 'Count','Percent','RiskValue'. g_sort_by_ht Forest Plot - include sorting high term/BYVAR1? Values: "Y"/"N". output, terms sorted group first, term. used along ht_dispyn = Y ae_forest_plot() riskdiff_pct display risk CI % statistic = risk difference (Y/N) sigdec Number decimal places % displayed output pctsyn Display Percentage Sign table . Values: "Y"/"N" hoveryn Include hover information (graphs) Y/N

title: Calculate Risk Statistics for treatment pairs from pre-processed Adverse Events data — risk_stat

code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # Example 1  data(adsl)  mentry_df <- adsl |>   mentry(     subset = "AGE < 60",     byvar = NA_character_,     trtvar = "TRT01A",     trtsort = "TRT01AN",     subgrpvar = NA_character_,     trttotalyn = "N",     add_grpmiss = "N",     pop_fil = "SAFFL"   ) |>   dplyr::mutate(XVAR = as.integer(factor(USUBJID)), YVAR = AGE) mentry_df |>   scatter_plot(     axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(       xlinearopts = list(         breaks = sort(unique(mentry_df$XVAR)),         labels = sort(unique(mentry_df$USUBJID))       ),       xopts = list(angle = 15)     ),     series_var = "TRTVAR",     series_labelvar = "TRTVAR",     series_opts = list(       shape = c(16, 17, 18),       color = scales::hue_pal()(3),       size = c(2, 2, 3)     ),     legend_opts = list(       label = "Treatment",       pos = "bottom",       dir = "horizontal"     ),     plot_title = "Scatter Plot of Subject vs Age"   )   # Example 2  iris |>   ### this step is required for `scatter_plot()` to work as it requires `XVAR` and `YVAR` present   ### in the data   mutate(XVAR = Sepal.Length, YVAR = Sepal.Width) |>   scatter_plot(     axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(),     series_var = "Species",     series_labelvar = "Species",     series_opts = list(       shape = c(16, 17, 18),       color = scales::hue_pal()(3),       size = c(2, 2, 3)     ),     legend_opts = list(       label = "Flower Species",       pos = "bottom",       dir = "horizontal"     ),     plot_title = "Generic Scatter plot with Iris data"   )

code: data("adsl") data("adae")  tornado_df <- process_tornado_data(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   dataset_analysis = adae,   adsl_subset = "SAFFL == 'Y'",   analysis_subset = "TRTEMFL == 'Y'",   obs_residual = "30",   fmq_data = NA,   ae_catvar = "AESEV/AESEVN",   trtvar = "ARM",   trt_left = "Xanomeline High Dose",   trt_right = "Xanomeline Low Dose",   pctdisp = "TRT",   denom_subset = NA_character_,   legendbign = "N",   yvar = "AESOC" ) #> mcatstat success  series_opts <- g_seriescol(tornado_df, "blue~yellow~red", "BYVAR1")  tornado_plot(   tornado_df,   trt_left_label = "DRUG B",   trt_right_label = "DRUG C",   bar_width = 0.5,   axis_opts = plot_axis_opts(     xaxis_label = "Primary System Organ Class",     yaxis_label = "% of Subjects",     ylinearopts = list(       breaks = seq(-100, 100, 10),       labels = c(seq(100, 0, -10), seq(10, 100, 10))     )   ),   legend_opts = list(     label = "Severity",     pos = c(0.15, 0.15),     dir = "vertical"   ),   series_opts = series_opts,   griddisplay = "N" ) #> Warning: Removed 106 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_col()`). #> Warning: Removed 106 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_col()`).

what: Find column names with starting pattern — var_start
title: Find column names with starting pattern — var_start
text: Searches column names given data.frame identify start given pattern. pattern given ends 'N', looks variables also end N. pattern end 'N', excludes variables end 'N' returning start pattern. eg. pattern = "BYVAR" may return c("BYVAR1","BYVAR2") Whereas "BYVARN" may return c("BYVAR1N","BYVAR2N"), exist.

title: Find column names with starting pattern — var_start
code: var_start(df, pattern)

title: Find column names with starting pattern — var_start
text: df data.frame input get names pattern String. ends N, matches start. ends N, matches start checks column name ends "N"

title: Find column names with starting pattern — var_start
code: data("ae_pre_process")  ae_pre <- mentry(   datain = ae_pre_process$data,   subset = NA,   byvar = "AEBODSYS~SEX",   trtvar = "TRTA",   trtsort = "TRTAN",   subgrpvar = NA,   trttotalyn = "N",   add_grpmiss = "N",   sgtotalyn = "N",   pop_fil = "SAFFL" )  var_start(ae_pre, "BYVARN") #> [1] "BYVAR1N" "BYVAR2N" var_start(ae_pre, "BYVAR") #> [1] "BYVAR1" "BYVAR2"
